page.title: 16Grangetown Shopping Centre
page.content: We went to{Grangetown}to look at its{shopping}centre. We noticed that there was a wide range of shops. They are mostly quite small - the biggest is called Shoppers' Paradise and it is Grangetown's only{supermarket. We found that there are two main types of shops. There are{food}stores like the butchers', the fruiterers' and the take-aways; there are also shops which provide a{service}like the post office, the banks, the building societies and the garages. The people of Grangetown do not seem to know which they like best - the cheaper prices of the supermarket or the friendly atmosphere of the dearer small shops. They do agree that they have a good shopping centre - they have got plenty of{choice}and it gives them a chance to have a natter with their friends.
